user.name: Gabriel Yee
user.bio:
ABOUT ME

Gabriel Yee, 15
Washington DC, USA

I am an aspiring software developer and data analyst, excited to take on challenges that push me beyond my comfort zone.
I've taken on various interests and hobbies, most of which have led me to project ideas and futuring my programming skills

work.title: Replit Bounty Hunter
work.description:
Freelancer through Replit Bounty Program
Full Stack Developer
Remote
Apr 2025 - Present

Tech Stack: Typescript, Javascript, Python, Flask, Bash, PostgreSQL, Java, AI

Worked with numerous individuals in order to help their ideas become reality. Coded and programmed numerous web apps and worked to successfully bring people's ideas to life.

hobbies.title: chess
hobbies.description:
Ever since I've been in elementary school, I've been captivated by chess. Until high school, I never fully dedicated myself to it.

Since then, I've achieved a 1200 Rapid rating and 1000 Blitz rating on Chess.com and a USCF rating of 886.

Tournaments of note that I have competed in include:
- Maryland Scholastic Championship 2025
- SUPERNATIONALS VIII

hobbies.title: robotics
hobbies.description:
I joined my high school's robotics team (Jagbots4638) in my freshman year and since then, I've been a huge contributing member to the team, even making a scouter app (found in the projects page!)

Throughout my time in the team, we've achieved the following awards:
- Reefscape District Event Finalist
- Excellence in Engineering Award (2025)

hobbies.title: nonprofit
hobbies.description:
Alongside 6 others, I helped to found SparkArts.

This 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization is dedicated to bridging the art divide between chilren in elementary school.

projects.name: Portfolio
projects.description: A portfolio website for software developers. The code is open sourced, enabling anyone to fork it and load up their own portfolio website.

projects.name: IMG2PGN
projects.description: Streamlining the digitization of chess notation sheets. By uploading a photo of your chess notation sheet, the program extracts the text and converts it into a usable PGN.

projects.name: JagBots Scouter
projects.description: A high-end analytical website designed to allow FRC teams to better scout and analyze the competition.

projects.name: WordHunt
projects.description: Developed alongside three others, this program won first place in the Brook Codes hackathon. This program recreates the popular iOS GamePigeon game, WordHunt for the web.

projects.name: ScoreTracker
projects.description: A simple, clean two team score tracker for usage on touchscreen devices
